content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 5 to node 8 is:

5 -> 8 -> 16 -> 24

Note that the path includes the intermediate nodes 15, 16, and 24. The path does not include the intermediate nodes 7, 13, and 18. If you want to know the shortest path including these intermediate nodes, you can use the same algorithm to find the shortest path between each of these nodes and node 8.

The shortest path from node 5 to node 16 is:

5 -> 8 -> 15 -> 16

Note that the path includes the intermediate nodes 8, 15, and 16. If you want to know the shortest path including other intermediate nodes, you can use the same algorithm to find the shortest path between each of these nodes and node 16.
